channel.title: [PI]Player-specific objects
channel.description:
Alright I am trying to add farming to my source, but I have come to the the problem that if somone were to rake the weeds, it would rake for other players aswell, aswell as when they plant it. If somone could help me by giving me something, or pointing me in the right direction, so that only the person that planted the plant can see it.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: [PI]Player-specific objects
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

object ticks is how many ticks before the object deletes I believe

object type is like, door, wall, ground object, i would just put 10 there.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Player-specific objects
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:2, topic:445012”][quote author=runescape sucks link=topic=547691.msg4015695#msg4015695 date=1339612682]
Alright I am trying to add farming to my source, but I have come to the the problem that if somone were to rake the weeds, it would rake for other players aswell, aswell as when they plant it. If somone could help me by giving me something, or pointing me in the right direction, so that only the person that planted the plant can see it.

Thanks in advance.
[/quote]

Farming uses configs, in PI to send configs you use either sendFrame36 or sendFrame87, depending on the amount of bytes.

But, if you really want to suck ass and do it the wrong way I suggest using this constructor

public Objects(final int id, final int x, final int y, final int height, final int face, final int type, final int ticks, String owner) { objectId = id; objectX = x; objectY = y; objectHeight = height; objectFace = face; objectType = type; objectTicks = ticks; this.owner = owner; }[/quote]

Do you mind explaining what “objectType” and “objectTicks” are?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Player-specific objects
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:1, topic:445012”]Alright I am trying to add farming to my source, but I have come to the the problem that if somone were to rake the weeds, it would rake for other players aswell, aswell as when they plant it. If somone could help me by giving me something, or pointing me in the right direction, so that only the person that planted the plant can see it.

Thanks in advance.[/quote]

Farming uses configs, in PI to send configs you use either sendFrame36 or sendFrame87, depending on the amount of bytes.

But, if you really want to suck ass and do it the wrong way I suggest using this constructor

public Objects(final int id, final int x, final int y, final int height, final int face, final int type, final int ticks, String owner) { objectId = id; objectX = x; objectY = y; objectHeight = height; objectFace = face; objectType = type; objectTicks = ticks; this.owner = owner; }

Read full topic
